FuncDef: The reset access statistics flow interface command clears statistics about user packets based on a specified BAS interface and VPN instance.
CLIs: reset access statistics flow interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset access statistics flow interface GigabitEthernet 1/0/1 vpn-instance 123
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If multiple users bound to VPN instances exist on a BAS interface, you can run the display access statistics interface command to check statistics about user packets and users. If a large number of such historical statistics exist on the device, it is inconvenient for analysis. To clear statistics about user packets based on a specified BAS interface and VPN instance, run the reset access statistics flow interface command. Then you can run the display access statistics interface command to view new statistics.
Precautions
The cleared statistics cannot be restored. Therefore, exercise caution when you perform this operation.
The reset access statistics flow interface command clears statistics about user packets on the master main control board only.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
